snippet: Walmart is looking to grab a bigger share of the billions of health care dollars being spent in the United States and to benefit from the shifting delivery system that has resulted from the Affordable Care Act.
abstract: Walmart continues to make aggressive push into medical care, opening five primary care clinic locations in South Carolina and Texas; nation's largest retailer is hoping to grab larger share of billions of health care dollars being spent in light of Affordable Care Act.
lead_paragraph: Walmart is looking to grab a bigger share of the billions of health care dollars being spent in the United States and to benefit from the shifting delivery system that has resulted from the Affordable Care Act.

headline.main: In Ambitious Bid, Walmart Seeks Foothold in Primary Care Services
headline.print_headline: In Ambitious Bid, Walmart Seeks Foothold in Primary Care Services

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
